Class Employee

  • java.lang.Object
    • Employee
  • public class Employee
extends java.lang.Object
    The employee class represents any type of employee paid hourly. Stores the employees name, hourly wage, and hours worked per week. Can calculate weekly wage.
    Author:
    Alex Louden

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Employee()
      Default Constructor.

      Constructor for employee class.

      Calculates weekly pay based on hours worked and hourly pay.
      static void printSalaryReport​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
      Takes in an arrayList of type Employee, and outputs all data including weekly salary to "employee.csv", with one employee per row.

      • printSalaryReport

        public static void printSalaryReport​(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees)
                              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Takes in an arrayList of type Employee, and outputs all data including weekly salary to "employee.csv", with one employee per row.
        Parameters:
        employees - An ArrayList of employee objects.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Unexpected error thrown by PrintWriter
